head.title: Jean R. Baity, David W. Plant

hedline.hl1: Jean R. Baity, David W. Plant

block.p: Jean Robinson Baity, the director of special events at the New York Botanical Garden in the Bronx, was married yesterday to David William Plant, a senior partner at the New York law firm of Fish & Neave. The Rev. Dr. David L. Uhl performed the ceremony at The Presbyterian Church in Rye, N.Y.

Jean Robinson Baity, the director of special events at the New York Botanical Garden in the Bronx, was married yesterday to David William Plant, a senior partner at the New York law firm of Fish & Neave. The Rev. Dr. David L. Uhl performed the ceremony at The Presbyterian Church in Rye, N.Y.

Mrs. Plant graduated from the University of Michigan. She is a daughter of Mabel E. Robinson of Winnetka, Ill., and the late William S. Robinson. Her father was the Evanston, Ill., branch manager for the Cadillac Motor Car Division of General Motors. Mr. Plant graduated from Cornell University, from which he also received a law degree. He is the son of the late Arthur and Margery Plant. His father was the president of the Libbey-Owens-Ford Glass Company of Canada in Collingwood, Ontario. The bridegroom was a widower. The bride's previous marriage ended in divorce.
